ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Julia E Anderson  Julia
Instructor: Julia E Anderson  Julia Anderson
Instructor: Julia E Anderson  Julia
Instructor: Julia E Anderson  She was great! Well organized, helpful, smart.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Julia E Anderson  Julia did a good job of leading class when Jessica was out of town.
Instructor: Julia E Anderson  i only observed strengths.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Jessica is a great professor. I really enjoyed interacting with her.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I enjoyed the project aspect of the class and the ability to do my own independent project.
I liked our field trips the best.
The field trips and outside speakers were great.
Field trips.
Jessica's knowledge, guest speakers, student presentations.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The course content was interesting but it seems that time management is an issue as we were often running out of time and speakers have to rush through towards the end of class
More direction in the form of meeting more often.
Some students didn't seem to prepare, and i think the course would be better if students were required to be a little more engaged.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
Lectures and discussion / field trips actually meshed rather well.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The course was key to filling in my knowledge of land use law, a weak spot before.

This is a capstone class and I would have expected that students taking the class would have taken some form of land use planning or land use law classes. Instead, it feels that most student come in without that background and some of the material were repetitive and only gleam the surface of issues.
It was a capstone i used to study the deployment of renewable energy on a massive scale.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: As a required capstone class for graduation
To work hands on a land use project that would benefit others in the surrounding community.
To study renewable energy and land use. It offered me exactly that so from that standpoint it was a huge success.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
I had a fulfilling time working on my project.
Not quite.
Yes it did.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I liked the group exercises that were part of some speakers' lectures.
Great group work experience. Supportive.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Pick a topic you really like...and get started early (don't leave it to the last minute!)
Take it! design a cool project too.
